title: The Enchanted Cottage: A Fable in Three Acts
description: The Enchanted A Fable in Three Acts is a play written by Arthur Wing Pinero and first published in 1922. The story is set in the English countryside during World War I and follows the lives of two people who are transformed by their experiences in a magical cottage. The main characters are Oliver Bashforth, a disfigured war veteran, and Laura Pennington, a plain and unremarkable woman. They meet and fall in love while staying at the cottage, which has a reputation for magically transforming those who stay there. The play explores themes of love, beauty, and the transformative power of the human spirit. It is a heartwarming story of two people finding love and acceptance in a world that can be cruel and unforgiving.
